image.altText: A blue 'for lease' sign outside of a house.

items.synopsis: Research shows that mortgage borrowers are paying the highest share of their income on housing costs in at least four decades, but the current situation for renters is not historically unusual.

title.children: Mortgage borrowers have never done it tougher, while renters are back to where they were in 2019

image.altText: Young white man with dark short hair and facial hair faces the camera with a neutral expression in a park. his arms are crossed

items.synopsis: Needle spiking is when a person is injected with a form of drug against without consent, and it's unknown how much it's happening in Australian venues.

title.children: Two friends blacked out while at a bar. Then they found the needle prick

image.altText: A local resident walks on a flooded street after the Nova Kakhovka dam breached.

items.synopsis: A vast Soviet-era dam in the Russian controlled part of southern Ukraine has been blown up, unleashing a flood of water across the war zone, according to both Ukrainian and Russian forces.

title.children: Ukraine villagers flee as dam in Russian-controlled Ukraine destroyed

image.altText: A sketch of prince harry sitting in front of a microphone in a courtroom

items.synopsis: Prince Harry has been grilled in court as the Mirror Newspaper Group's legal team has sought to discredit his allegations its journalists engaged in unlawful information-gathering practices to publish stories about him.

title.children: Prince Harry in 'realm of total speculation', Mirror lawyer says as duke takes stand in court

image.altText: A close up shot of a woman holing and looking at her newborn baby in a hospital bed.

items.synopsis: Women of migrant backgrounds are more at risk of developing some pregnancy complications, which can limit their choices for their pregnancy care and lead to more medical interventions during birth.

title.children: 'It felt like control was taken away from me': Pregnancy complications putting migrant women at risk

image.altText: Portrait of an older woman with short grey hair. She's got a red top on and a black jacket.

items.synopsis: It's deflating to start a new job only to realise what it seemed like on paper doesn't match the reality. Here's how to avoid getting trapped.

title.children: If you're applying for jobs, there's one 'dangerous word' this expert says you should look out for

image.altText: Three surgeons work together in a hospital.

items.synopsis: Federal independent MPs say a culture of public servants "bending to political will" is undermining fairness in government spending and leading to "pork barrelling".

title.children: 'It'll have enormous flow on impact': Independents call for action after hospital rorts

image.altText: A man in a suit walkig out of court.

items.synopsis: A "veteran of brothels" convicted of raping, choking and spitting in the mouth of a sex worker at a Canberra brothel, has walked free from court after being sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: 'Veteran of brothels' who raped and choked Canberra sex worker walks free

image.altText: Philip Lowe sitting at a desk behind a microphone mid-sentence, gesturing with his right hand and looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Reserve Bank Governor Philip Lowe and his board have pushed up interest rates yet again – for the twelfth time in 14 months – because they want to damage the economy further, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Time is running out for RBA chief — but so is the patience of borrowers and renters

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a spreading patch of fire in bushland, with masses of smoke rising from the fire.

items.synopsis: An army officer who was on board the Defence helicopter that started the devastating January 2020 Orroral Valley fire near Canberra tells a coronial inquest he had forgotten to turn off the searchlight that sparked the blaze.

title.children: Army officer tells Orroral Valley fire inquiry he forgot to turn off the searchlight that sparked blaze

image.altText: A man wearing a car backwards stands by a bright green car, with its doors open.

items.synopsis: A man accused of threatening Nick Kyrgios's mother at gunpoint and stealing her son's car, pleads not guilty to aggravated armed robbery in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Canberra man pleads not guilty to pointing gun at Nick Kyrgios's mother and stealing tennis star's Tesla

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg, as a younger woman with long dark hair, looks at the camera and smiles.

items.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg spent 20 years in jail for killing her children. The NSW Attorney General has now extended an unconditional pardon. But there are psychological and practical challenges ahead. Here's what the research tells us.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg's release from prison might seem like a storybook ending but some challenges are just beginning

image.altText: red blue and whit sign in front of a tall building and car park

items.synopsis: An independent investigation is underway and a review has been conducted after a group of 30 women complain about maternity care they received at the Wagga Wagga Base Hospital in NSW's Central West.

title.children: Investigation underway after 30 women complain about maternity experience at NSW hospital

image.altText: Man sits on bed writing

items.synopsis: A year ago, Thomas was a home owner. Now he expects to wait years before securing social housing.

title.children: 'I need a roof over my head': Growing demand for social housing sees waitlist balloon

image.altText: A suburban street; a white, one-storey house on the left and an unfinished two-storey house on the right

items.synopsis: The construction industry insolvency crisis is sweeping the nation, and it's devastating for both consumers and builders. So what can be done about it?

title.children: Builders go bust in record numbers, leaving thousands of Australian home owners in the lurch

image.altText: A man sits at a table wearing a cap and looking straight ahead.

items.synopsis: The PGA Tour, European Tour and rival Saudi-backed LIV Golf circuit announce a landmark agreement to merge and form a commercial entity to unify golf.

title.children: PGA Tour agrees to merge with Saudi-backed LIV Golf

image.altText: A young man.

items.synopsis: Joel Russo, who was only months out of prison when he repeatedly raped a female jogger on the banks of Melbourne's Merri Creek is jailed for more than 20 years.

title.children: Serial rapist jailed for 'horrendous' attack on female jogger along Melbourne creek

image.altText: Two middle aged women leaning together with big smiles

items.synopsis: Ms Folbigg spent her first day of freedom since 2003 enjoying simple pleasures, like a comfortable bed and pizza, her best friend Tracy Chapman says.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg 'extremely humbled' and 'grateful' after release

image.altText: a woman lying on the green grass with a baby by her side

items.synopsis: Extensive scientific and medical evidence proved to be key to setting Kathleen Folbigg free, 20 years after she was convicted of killing her four children.

title.children: The one-in-35-million mutation and the science that set Kathleen Folbigg free

image.altText: A dry lake bed.

items.synopsis: Scientists say we need to make 'very rapid and very large' emissions cuts as atmospheric CO2 jumps to an all-time high at the Mauna Loa Atmospheric Baseline Observatory.

title.children: At Hawaii's Mauna Loa observatory, CO2 levels have broken a new record

image.altText: a skyline with houses

items.synopsis: Interest rates climb above 4 per cent for the first time in more than 11 years, as the Reserve Bank moves aggressively to clamp down on inflation.

title.children: Property analyst warns of 'panicky selling' as RBA pushes interest rates past breaking point

image.altText: A woman holding bills outside a house

items.synopsis: Mia De Rauch says she has "no more time to give" as she runs a video production business and works hospitality shifts to keep up with increasing mortgage repayments and bills.

title.children: Rates rise smashes business owner already working two jobs

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

items.synopsis: Tell us your loan size, term and interest rate, and our mortgage repayment calculator will work out how much extra you may have to pay on your loan.

title.children: How much extra could mortgage repayments be, now that the cash rate is 4.1 per cent?

image.altText: A close up of Angus speaking against a dark blue background.

items.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor says Australia has higher core inflation than all of the countries in the G7. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.

title.children: Fact check: Is Australia's core inflation higher than all countries in the G7?

image.altText: Tasmanian petrol prices falling

items.synopsis: A Tasmanian man who used a company fuel card to buy more than $24,000 worth of fuel, some of which he onsold to friends, avoids prison — the court acknowledging his marriage breakdown caused "great upheaval" for him before the offending started.

title.children: Man uses employer's fuel card to unlawfully buy more than $20k of petrol

image.altText: The roots of a branch photographed against the cracked, dry earth.

items.synopsis: The odds of a warm, dry winter and spring have shortened after the Bureau of Meteorology took its El Niño warning to a new level.

title.children: Bureau declares El Niño alert, signalling higher chance of warm, dry weather

image.altText: young man with brown hair wearing hooded jacket while using vape

items.synopsis: Although New Zealand has one of the lowest rates of adult smoking in the OECD, it has banned future generations from smoking in a push to be "smoke-free" by 2025.

title.children: New Zealand bans vape names, considers plain packaging to help curb vaping amongst young people

image.altText: Chau with his mother-in-law, wife Trang and son Daniel.

items.synopsis: The family of a retired Sydney baker jailed in Vietnam for 12 years on "terrorism" offences express new hope for his freedom after Anthony Albanese's visit to the South-East Asian nation.

title.children: 'She cannot wait to see her husband again': New hopes for Australian detained in Vietnam, after PM's visit

image.altText: A man with long, blonde, curly hair, poses and smiles at a camera, wearing a pattern shirt, standing in front of a window.

items.synopsis: Scott Phillip White will be sentenced on Thursday for the manslaughter of Scott Johnson, whose body was found at the base of cliffs at Manly in 1988.

title.children: 'No leniency': Man urges maximum jail term for brother's killer after 35yo mystery solved

image.altText: A birds eye view of a mine with a pit and a pool of water.

items.synopsis: This Bougainville community is living on a literal goldmine, but some residents say that despite it being abandoned for decades, it poses a risk to their environment and human rights.

title.children: The waters in this part of a remote jungle are so blue there are fears over what runs in them
